The word "ciao is an informal salutation in the Italian language that is used for 
both "hello" and "goodbye". Originally from the Venetian language, it has entered 
the vocabulary of English and of many other languages around the world. Its dual 
meaning of "hello" and "goodbye" makes it similar to shalom in ... ("hello" or "
goodbye"); French: ciao, tchao (mostly used to say "goodbye").
